name: Orange Chicken Stir Fry
author: Kelly Dale-Carpenter
summary: Chicken breast meat stir fried with orange juice and zest, soy sauce, garlic and brown sugar, topped with bean sprouts and served over crispy chow mein noodles. A healthy, zesty stir fry treat guaranteed to excite the most finicky eaters!
ingredients: 4  skinless, boneless chicken breast halves - cut into 1 inch cubes
1 (6 ounce) package crispy chow mein noodles
directions: In a small bowl combine the orange juice, orange zest, soy sauce, salt, garlic and brown sugar
Heat oil in a large skillet or wok over medium high heat
When oil begins to bubble, add chicken
Saute until cooked through (no longer pink inside), about 7 to 10 minutes
Add orange sauce mixture to chicken and cook until sauce begins to bubble
Add flour, a little bit at a time, until sauce has thickened to your liking
Add bean sprouts and cook for 1 minute; serve hot over chow mein noodles
